content: During next week's libs-api team meeting I'd like to talk about having a process for more officially supporting discussions at earlier stages of the design process, since @Mara has highlighted some issues around our current process often pushing people towards providing solutions without necessarily focusing on the problems being solved or leaving space for alternative solutions
this came up again during the Rust Linz meetup where the Rust for linux people gave a presentation
they discussed needing official support for safe pin projections

and suggested language support, though I'm not sure that we should necessarily jump to language support, but also they had no idea how to go about exploring the solution space and weren't sure if they should submit an RFC or a Pre-RFC or keep just talking about it to ppl
so I mentioned this idea I'd discussed with mara and they seemed excited about it
I want to discuss it with the rest of the team and if everyone is on board work on the supporting docs to get it rolling

one thing I do think we need to be careful about is increasing the amount of discussions that are going on beyond the libs-api teams capacity to support, so for the official "in project" pre-rfcs I think we might want a mechanism similar to the lang team's MCP process
where we have to have a libs team member second the issue in order to open it up for general discussion / make a call for proposed solutions
Lang has tooling in progress for that; I'm hoping that tooling will be easy for other teams to adopt/adapt.
